sanskrit_verse:
फलं कतकवृक्षस्य यद्यप्यम्बुप्रसादकम् ।
न नामग्रहणादेव तस्य वारि प्रसीदति ॥ ६.६७॥
transliteration:
Phalaṁ katakavṛkṣasya yadyapyambuprasādakam |
Na nāmagrahaṇādeva tasya vāri prasīdati || 6.67||
sph_interpretive_translation: Even if the fruit of the katka tree is capable of purifying water, merely uttering its name does not cause the water to become pure.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is established through direct causal action, not symbolic declaration.
Causation requires embodied manifestation, not mere verbal assertion.
Capacity-based responsibility arises only when actual engagement occurs.
Restoration logic operates through effective alignment, not performative utterance.
Consciousness alignment demands experiential realization, not nominal invocation.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a claimed capacity lacks manifest enactment THEN it shall not produce juridical effect.
ONLY acts bearing causal integrity shall activate dharma-adhikara.
NAMING alone shall NOT instantiate dharmic consequence in adjudication systems.
RESTORATIVE JUSTICE requires completion of actionable alignment, not linguistic performance.
RESPONSIBILITY attribution MUST trace to verifiable causal sequence, not semantic assertion.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, declarations or titles without corresponding operative conduct shall not confer legal efficacy. Authority is recognized only where causal agency is demonstrated through verifiable action aligned with dharma-siddhanta.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana-based causality establishes that purification results from direct interaction, not naming. Anupurvasah reveals that consciousness-effect follows sequential embodiment, not linguistic fiat. Responsibility aligns proportionally to enacted causation. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that outcome arises only through integral participation, never through nominal reference.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Mandate experiential engagement to validate claimed capacities.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Require actor to demonstrate causal linkage before asserting authority.
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Realign intent with action to ensure dharma-conformant outcomes.
Integrity Reintegration Procedure: Confirm ontological consistency between claim and manifestation.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the Sole Source of Dharma. Justice executed for restoration, not punishment. Reality affirmed as non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate Adjudicator.
